alert.note: Alert for Central Cook; Southern Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 02 at 5:49PM CST until February 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Lake effect snow showers expected, along with patchy blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Central Cook and Southern Cook Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on at least locally slippery road conditions and in places, sharply varying visibility. These hazardous conditions will likely impact the Thursday morning commute in parts of Cook County, and possibly the Thursday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lake effect snow often varies greatly in snowfall amounts and impacts over short distances.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.
